thread.title: 2GB RAM variant of the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale tomorrow, priced at Rs 9,999
thread.title_full: 2GB RAM variant of the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale tomorrow, priced at Rs 9,999

title: 2GB RAM variant of the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale tomorrow, priced at Rs 9,999
text:
Home Android Phones 2GB RAM variant of the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on... 2GB RAM variant of the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale tomorrow, priced at Rs 9,999 By - February 2, 2017 “The Redmi Note 4 sports an all-metal body, a 5.5-inch 1080p display, a Snapdragon 625 SoC and a 4,100mAh battery” 
Last month, Xiaomi launched its latest Redmi Note series smartphone called the Redmi Note 4 in India. The phone comes in three configurations including 2GB + 32GB, 3GB + 32GB and 4GB + 64GB. However, in the first couple of flash sales, only the pricier variants of the phone were made available. But, now the brand has announced that the base 2GB variant of the device will go on sale in India tomorrow on mi.com at 12 pm along with the other two models. 
For the uninitiated, the Xiaomi Redmi Note 4’s base model sports 2GB RAM and 32GB storage, and is priced at Rs 9,999. The 3GB / 32GB and 4GB / 64GB models are being offered for Rs 10,999 and Rs 12,999 respectively. Recently, the brand revealed that it sold over 2,50,000 units of the phone on Flipkart and mi.com in just 10 minutes in the first flash sale. 
To recap the specs, the Redmi Note 4 ( review ) offers a 5.5-inch full HD display, a Snapdragon 625 SoC, 13MP/5MP cameras, a fingerprint sensor, 4G, VoLTE, IR blaster, a 4,100mAh battery and MIUI 8 based on Marshmallow. Facebook Comments
